extracted_text:
HDFC Mutual Fund Riskometer Ratings:

1. HDFC Large Cap Fund:
- Scheme Riskometer: Moderately High (Level 5 out of 6)
- Benchmark Riskometer: Moderately High
- Risk Category: Large Cap funds typically have moderately high risk as they invest in established, large-cap companies
- Source: HDFC Mutual Fund Official Disclosures

2. HDFC Mid Cap Fund (Mid Cap Opportunities Fund):
- Scheme Riskometer: Very High (Level 6 out of 6)
- Benchmark Riskometer: Very High
- Risk Category: Mid cap funds have very high risk due to higher volatility in mid-sized companies
- Source: HDFC Mutual Fund Official Disclosures

3. HDFC Small Cap Fund:
- Scheme Riskometer: Very High (Level 6 out of 6)
- Benchmark Riskometer: Very High
- Risk Category: Small cap funds have very high risk due to significant volatility and liquidity concerns in small-cap stocks
- Source: HDFC Mutual Fund Official Disclosures

4. HDFC Flexi Cap Fund:
- Scheme Riskometer: Very High (Level 6 out of 6)
- Benchmark Riskometer: Very High
- Risk Category: Flexi cap funds have very high risk as they can invest across market capitalizations with flexibility
- Source: HDFC Mutual Fund Official Disclosures

5. HDFC Multi Cap Fund:
- Scheme Riskometer: Very High (Level 6 out of 6)
- Benchmark Riskometer: Very High
- Risk Category: Multi cap funds have very high risk due to diversified exposure across large, mid, and small cap stocks
- Source: HDFC Mutual Fund Official Disclosures

Riskometer Scale (SEBI Standard):
- Level 1: Low
- Level 2: Low to Moderate
- Level 3: Moderate
- Level 4: Moderately High
- Level 5: High
- Level 6: Very High

Note: Riskometer ratings are updated monthly by mutual funds. For the latest riskometer, investors should refer to the Monthly Portfolios disclosed on www.hdfcfund.com
